Authors:
Roger G. Shivas, Sandeep Sharma, Scot Nelson, Sarah J
Pethybridge, Niloofar Vaghefi
Title:
Phylogeny of cercosporoid fungi (Mycosphaerellaceae) from
Hawaii and New York discovers novel species within the Cercospora
beticola complex
Abstract:
The taxonomy of 44 specimens of cercosporoid fungi from
Hawaii and New York, USA, was elucidated through multi-locus
phylogenetic analyses of the LSU and ITS regions of the nrDNA as well as
partial sequences of the actin, calmodulin, histone H3, and translation
elongation factor 1-α genes. Sequences of four additional loci, namely,
partial beta-tubulin, glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase, the
second largest subunit of RNA polymerase II, and the cercosporin
facilitator protein encoding gene were used to resolve evolutionary
species boundaries within the Cercospora beticola species complex using
concatenated multi-locus phylogenies and the genealogical divergence
index (gdi). Four novel Cercospora species, C. americana sp. nov., C.
hawaiiensis sp. nov., C. manoana sp. nov., and C. tecta sp. nov. are
described. Neocercospora carotae comb. nov. is proposed to replace
Cercospora apii var. carotae, which is neotypified. Cercospora
cf. citrulina and Pseudocercospora ocimi-basilici are reported for the
first time in Hawaii. Cercospora beticola, Pluripassalora bougainvilleae
and Pseudocercospora pittospori are confirmed as present in Hawaii.
Strelitziana africana, isolated from leaves of Ipomoea pes-caprae and
Bougainvillea sp. affected by Cercospora spp., is reported for the first
time in the USA.
